snippet: Producer prices also rose in July, with a 0.3 percent increase that was the fastest pace in five months.
abstract: Commerce Department reports retail sales rose in July for the first time in four months as demand increased for goods, a sign that consumers could drive faster economic growth in the third quarter.
lead_paragraph: Producer prices also rose in July, with a 0.3 percent increase that was the fastest pace in five months.

headline.seo: Retail Sales Rose 0.8% in July, Exceeding Forecasts
headline.main: July Retail Sales Rose 0.8%, Well Beyond Expectations
headline.print_headline: July Retail Sales Rose 0.8%, Well Beyond Expectations
